originalText.text: I ordered from OAKBERRY 72nd St 24oz A√ßa√≠ bowl.  They never sealed it or closed the cover correctly.  It came delivered like this.  It was left at my front door.  When I called the store the guy said he made my order and there is nothing he can do about it.  This is terrible and disgusting. I love OAKBERRY.  Go to the other locations but do not go to this one.  Bad service.

originalText.text:
Oakberry is a smoothie and juice bar chain with locations worldwide.  One of their newest locations opened last month in the Upper West Side.  The storefront is small, non-descript looking and has no signage whatsoever.  You can easily miss it if you are walking too quickly.  Honestly, I almost gave up on visiting this location.  They have strange hours which aren‚Äôt posted anywhere.  On my first two visits they were closed--I went around 6:30pm and the next day at 6pm.  Finally, on my third try at 5:30pm, I found them open.

At Oakberry‚Äôs the bowls and smoothies come in three sizes (The Classic 12oz, The Works 16oz and The Oak 24oz) and in cups (not bowls). Regular toppings are unlimited. They are also Kosher, gluten free, lactose free, and GMO free.

I got The Works Acai Bowl with Granola, Almonds, Bananas, Strawberries, and Almond Butter.  It was delicious and so refreshing! The fruit was fresh, and the acai was sweet.  It‚Äôs one of the better tasting acai bowls I‚Äôve had.  I especially liked that they layer the granola and almonds with the acai which made every bite perfect.  The Works at 16oz was very big and I was full afterwards.  Probably should have gotten The Classic instead.

Overall, it was very good but I must note that this was one of the more expensive acai bowl that I‚Äôve ever purchased.  While it was really delicious, it was a splurge.

originalText.text: Insanely good a√ßa√≠. As in, best I‚Äôve ever had, by some margin. Priced at 2023 inflation rates, which should come down at some point. Still, can‚Äôt beat the product. So five stars.

originalText.text: Finally caved and decided to try an acai bowl to see what all the fuss is about.  Love at first bite!  I have tried acai hotels at several other places but Oakberry is by far the best-- live their pb crunch and wide variety of options. Heartbroken that they for ride off cashew butter-- please bring it back!! üôè üòã

originalText.text: I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs good if you get it with toppings but I was hoping to just a healthy low cal snack. Was not expecting it to be so sugary. Almost $11 with tax and sadly tossed most of it.
